lines.text: Enter THURIO, PROTEUS, and JULIA

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: Sir Proteus, what says Silvia to my suit?

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: O, sir, I find her milder than she was; And yet she takes exceptions at your person.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: What, that my leg is too long?

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: No; that it is too little.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: I'll wear a boot, to make it somewhat rounder.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: [Aside]  But love will not be spurr'd to what it loathes.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: What says she to my face?

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: She says it is a fair one.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: Nay then, the wanton lies; my face is black.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: But pearls are fair; and the old saying is, Black men are pearls in beauteous ladies' eyes.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: [Aside]  'Tis true; such pearls as put out ladies' eyes; For I had rather wink than look on them.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: How likes she my discourse?

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Ill, when you talk of war.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: But well, when I discourse of love and peace?

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: [Aside]  But better, indeed, when you hold your peace.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: What says she to my valour?

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: O, sir, she makes no doubt of that.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: [Aside]  She needs not, when she knows it cowardice.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: What says she to my birth?

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: That you are well derived.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: [Aside]  True; from a gentleman to a fool.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: Considers she my possessions?

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: O, ay; and pities them.

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: Wherefore?

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: [Aside]  That such an ass should owe them.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: That they are out by lease.

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: Here comes the duke.
Enter DUKE

lines.speaker: duke
lines.text: How now, Sir Proteus! how now, Thurio! Which of you saw Sir Eglamour of late?

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: Not I.

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Nor I.

lines.speaker: duke
lines.text: Saw you my daughter?

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: Neither.

lines.speaker: duke
lines.text: Why then, She's fled unto that peasant Valentine; And Eglamour is in her company. 'Tis true; for Friar Laurence met them both, As he in penance wander'd through the forest; Him he knew well, and guess'd that it was she, But, being mask'd, he was not sure of it; Besides, she did intend confession At Patrick's cell this even; and there she was not; These likelihoods confirm her flight from hence. Therefore, I pray you, stand not to discourse, But mount you presently and meet with me Upon the rising of the mountain-foot That leads towards Mantua, whither they are fled: Dispatch, sweet gentlemen, and follow me.
Exit

lines.speaker: thurio
lines.text: Why, this it is to be a peevish girl, That flies her fortune when it follows her. I'll after, more to be revenged on Eglamour Than for the love of reckless Silvia.
Exit

lines.speaker: proteus
lines.text: And I will follow, more for Silvia's love Than hate of Eglamour that goes with her.
Exit

lines.speaker: julia
lines.text: And I will follow, more to cross that love Than hate for Silvia that is gone for love.
Exit
